com.brashmonkey.spriter

Class Drawer<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brashmonkey.spriter.Drawer<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The backend specific resource. In general such a resource is called "sprite", "texture" or "image".
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LibGdxDrawer

    public abstract class Drawer<R>
extends java.lang.Object
    A Drawer is responsible for drawing a Player. Since this library is meant to be as generic as possible this class has to be abstract, because it cannot be assumed how to draw a resource. Anyone who wants to draw a Player has to know how to draw a resource. A resource can be e.g. a sprite, a texture or a texture region. To draw a Player call draw(Player). This method relies on #draw(Object), which has to be implemented with the chosen backend. To debug draw a Player call drawBones(Player), drawBoxes(Player) and drawPoints(Player), which rely on rectangle(float, float, float, float), circle(float, float, float), line(float, float, float, float) and setColor(float, float, float, float).

      protected Loader<R> loader

      The radius of a point for debug drawing purposes.
